name: Pork Tenderloin with Apple Cider Reduction
author: Sara Snider

ingredients.name: lb pork tenderloin, cut in 1/2 crosswise

instructions: Heat oven 500°, arrange rack in upper third oven. Pat tenderloin dry w/ paper towels, brush with oil, and season well with salt & pepper. Heat large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 pieces of tenderloin and cook until brown in all sides, turning occasionally about four minutes. Set pork aside on baking sheet & repeat with remaining pieces. Place pork in oven & cook until thermometer reads 145°-150° (about 15 mins). Meanwhile, place pan in oven, high heat, add cider & vinegar & stir, scrapping browned bits. Cook until mixture is reduced by 2/3rds (about 8mins). Reduce heat to medium, stir in maple syrup and remove from heat until pork is cooked. When pork is ready, remove to a cutting board to rest  for 5 mins. Slice pork & add to sauce. Heat & Serve
